snippet: The United States is poised to increase its nonlethal aid to opposition groups as pressure builds to lift a European Union embargo on sending arms to Syria.
abstract: Long-debated move by Western nations to expand support for Syria’s opposition gains momentum, with United States poised to increase its nonlethal aid to rebel groups and pressure building to lift European Union embargo on sending arms to Syria.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from London, and Mark Landler from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The United States is poised to increase its nonlethal aid to opposition groups as pressure builds to lift a European Union embargo on sending arms to Syria.

headline.seo: Move to Widen Support for Syria Rebels Gains Speed
headline.main: Move to Widen Help for Syrian Rebels Gains Speed in West
headline.print_headline: Move to Expand Support to Syrian Rebels Gains Speed Among Western Nations

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
